definition: the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: It is certainly much more than mere background music.
sentences.chinese: 爵士乐绝不仅仅只是背景音乐。

sentences.english: Bull; I hate those places where they always play Muzak .
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌那些一直不停播放背景音乐的场所。

sentences.english: Mansell produces some of the finest scores to movies.
sentences.chinese: 曼瑟尔为电影创作了不少精彩的背景音乐。

sentences.english: This entry was posted in Music. Bookmark the permalink.
sentences.chinese: 背景音乐即是这首歌曲。
它们将成为完美的背景音乐。

sentences.english: Add some background music and I’m lost – in a good way.
sentences.chinese: 添加点背景音乐，沉浸在美好之中。

sentences.english: Become an extending far sentiment song in peaceful background music.
sentences.chinese: 在安静的背景音乐中，成为一首绵长的抒情曲。

sentences.english: And use the Peking Opera excerpts as background music.
sentences.chinese: 并配合京剧名段作为背景音乐。

sentences.english: Background music plays a critical part in striptease dancing.
sentences.chinese: 背景音乐在脱衣舞中起着关键的作用。

sentences.english: If the management provides pleasant background music and beautifies the dull setting.
sentences.chinese: 如果厂方播放悦耳的背景音乐，美化一下单调的环境。

sentences.english: The background music is too noisy in the tearoom .
sentences.chinese: 茶室的背景音乐太吵了。

definition: opening titles (of movie)/leader (blank film at the beginning and end of a reel)
